intro: Halotis pilifera, commonly known as the silky sea hare, is a species of sea slug found in tropical and subtropical marine environments. It belongs to the family Aplysiidae and is characterized by its soft, gelatinous body covered in fine, silky threads. The plant-like appearance of Halotis pilifera is due to its ability to absorb nutrients through its skin, a feature common among many opisthobranch mollusks. It thrives in shallow coastal waters and is often found in areas with abundant algae. The species plays a role in marine ecosystems by grazing on algae and contributing to nutrient cycling.
